key.name: include-list
key.summary: Folders to save
key.description: This list of directories will be backed up. Reserved values $HOME, $DESKTOP, $DOCUMENTS, $DOWNLOAD, $MUSIC, $PICTURES, $PUBLIC_SHARE, $TEMPLATES, $TRASH, and $VIDEOS are recognized as the user’s special directories and can be at the start of a longer path ($HOME/subdir). Reserved value $USER is replaced by the user’s username and can be anywhere in the path. Relative entries are relative to the user’s home directory.

key.name: exclude-list
key.summary: Folders to ignore
key.description: This list of directories will not be backed up. Reserved values $HOME, $DESKTOP, $DOCUMENTS, $DOWNLOAD, $MUSIC, $PICTURES, $PUBLIC_SHARE, $TEMPLATES, $TRASH, and $VIDEOS are recognized as the user’s special directories and can be at the start of a longer path ($HOME/subdir). Reserved value $USER is replaced by the user’s username and can be anywhere in the path. Relative entries are relative to the user’s home directory.

key.name: root-prompt
key.summary: Whether to request the root password
key.description: Whether to request the root password when backing up from or restoring to system folders.

key.name: last-run
key.summary: The last time Déjà Dup was run
key.description: The last time Déjà Dup was successfully run. This time should be in ISO 8601 format.

key.name: last-backup
key.summary: The last time Déjà Dup backed up
key.description: The last time Déjà Dup successfully completed a backup. This time should be in ISO 8601 format.

key.name: last-restore
key.summary: The last time Déjà Dup restored
key.description: The last time Déjà Dup successfully completed a restore. This time should be in ISO 8601 format.

key.name: periodic
key.summary: Whether to periodically back up
key.description: Whether to automatically back up on a regular schedule.

key.name: periodic-period
key.summary: How often to periodically back up
key.description: The number of days between backups.

key.name: prompt-check
key.summary: The last time Déjà Dup checked whether it should prompt about backing up
key.description: When a user logs in, the Déjà Dup monitor checks whether it should prompt about backing up. This is used to increase discoverability for users that don’t know about backups. This time should be either ‘disabled’ to turn off this check or in ISO 8601 format.

key.name: nag-check
key.summary: The last time Déjà Dup checked whether it should prompt about your password
key.description: In order to prevent you from forgetting your passwords, Déjà Dup will occasionally notify you to confirm the password. This time should be either ‘disabled’ to turn off this check or in ISO 8601 format.

key.name: delete-after
key.summary: How long to keep backup files
key.description: The number of days to keep backup files on the backup location. A value of 0 means forever. This is a minimum number of days; the files may be kept longer.

key.name: full-backup-period
key.summary: How long to wait between full backups
key.description: Déjà Dup needs to occasionally make fresh full backups. This is the number of days to wait between full backups.

key.name: backend
key.summary: Type of location to store backup
key.description: The type of backup location. If ‘auto’, a default will be chosen based on what is available.

key.name: id
key.summary: Amazon S3 Access Key ID
key.description: Your Amazon S3 Access Key Identifier. This acts as your S3 username.

key.name: bucket
key.summary: The Amazon S3 bucket name to use
key.description: Which Amazon S3 bucket to store files in. This does not need to exist already. Only legal hostname strings are valid.

key.name: folder
key.summary: The Amazon S3 folder
key.description: An optional folder name to store files in. This folder will be created in the chosen bucket.

key.name: id
key.summary: Google Cloud Storage Access Key ID
key.description: Your Google Cloud Storage Access Key Identifier. This acts as your Google Cloud Storage username.

key.name: bucket
key.summary: The Google Cloud Storage bucket name to use
key.description: Which Google Cloud Storage bucket to store files in. This does not need to exist already. Only legal hostname strings are valid.

key.name: folder
key.summary: The Google Cloud Storage folder
key.description: An optional folder name to store files in. This folder will be created in the chosen bucket.

key.name: email
key.summary: The email-address of your Google account
key.description: The email-address of your Google account.

key.name: folder
key.summary: The folder where backups are stored
key.description: The folder hierarchy where backups are stored.

key.name: container
key.summary: The Rackspace Cloud Files container
key.description: Which Rackspace Cloud Files container to store files in. This does not need to exist already. Only legal hostname strings are valid.

key.name: username
key.summary: Your Rackspace username
key.description: This is your username for the Rackspace Cloud Files service.

key.name: container
key.summary: The OpenStack Swift container
key.description: Which OpenStack Swift container to store files in. This does not need to exist already. Only legal hostname strings are valid.

key.name: username
key.summary: Your OpenStack username
key.description: This is your username for the OpenStack Swift service.

key.name: tenant
key.summary: Your OpenStack tenant
key.description: This is your tenant for the OpenStack Swift service.

key.name: authurl
key.summary: Authentication URL
key.description: This is the Authentication URL, or keystone URL for the OpenStack service

key.name: path
key.summary: Backup location
key.description: Location in which to hold the backup files.

key.name: type
key.summary: Folder type
key.description: Whether the backup location is a mounted external volume or a normal folder.

key.name: relpath
key.summary: Relative path under the external volume
key.description: If the backup location is on an external volume, this is the path of the folder on that volume.

key.name: uuid
key.summary: Unique ID of the external volume
key.description: If the backup location is on an external volume, this is its unique filesystem identifier.

key.name: name
key.summary: Full name of the external volume
key.description: If the backup location is on an external volume, this is the volume’s longer descriptive name.

key.name: short-name
key.summary: Short name of the external volume
key.description: If the backup location is on an external volume, this is the volume’s shorter name.

key.name: icon
key.summary: Icon of the external volume
key.description: If the backup location is on an external volume, this is the volume’s icon.
